oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scene of starlight musicale, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about a musicale at the Lewis home. The caption reads: “Mr. and Mrs. John Lewis are seen on the lawns of their home, “Singing Waters,” on Hillcrest Avenue, where the beautiful annual Starlight Musicale program will be held Tuesday evening, June 18, by the Study and Service Group of the First Presbyterian Church for the benefit of the Neighborhood House on McGavock Street. Sprays of water are thrown into the air and form a curtain for the stage when colored lights are turned upon the waters between acts.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lewis, John
